text: Lost in the Garden is a midlife-crisis novel by the American writer Philip Beard. Set in contemporary Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, it tells the story of 45-year-old Michael Benedict, who after the failure of his marriage, moves back with his parents and sets himself a goal of breaking 70 in his golf game and making the Champions Tour by age 50. ==References== Category:2006 American novels Category:Novels set in Pittsburgh Category:Novels about golf Category:Midlife crisis in fiction Category:Viking Press books
